info.name: Disney Characters Documentation
info.description:
This is a basic API to do operations about character and movies from the Disney's world.

#### Dependencies
* NodeJs 
* Express
* Sequelize
* [SendGrid](https://sendgrid.com/)
* JsonWebToken
* bcrypt
* wingston

#### Before start
This API uses an third party services for sending emails, so before start i recommend to create an account on [SendGrid](https://sendgrid.com/) and generate an API key to the correct usage.

#### Usage
1. Install the dependecies
> npm install
2.Rename the **env.example** file to **.env** to the sensitive data and complete the fields with your configurations
3.Start the API

 Production: 
   > **npm start** 

 Development:
   > **npm run dev**

item.name: Auth

request.description:
For register you need to send a model of user that u want to save it on database,
this must contain:
* firstname *[ String(max:50 characters), Optional ]*
* lastname *[ String(max:50 characters), Optional ]*
* username *[ String(min:5 characters, max:16 characters ), Required, unique]*
* email *[ String(max: 80 ), Email Format, Required, unique]*
* password *[ String(will be encrypted ), Required ]*

response.name: Register response email is required
Register response email must be an email

request.description: When a new user is registered, you can generate a new token by login, sending the user email and the password, if it match will response the token and user data.

response.name: Login response no email

item.description: For the usage of the API, you need a token sent by headers, name **Authorization**, you can get the token by this Auth operations

item.name: Characters

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

body.raw:
{ 
    "name": "DeadPool", 
    "image_url": "https://holatelcel.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/Deadpool-Marvel.png",
    "age": 30,
    "weight": 81,
    "history": "The character's back-story has been presented as vague and subject to change, and within the narrative he is unable to remember his personal history due to a mental condition. Whether or not his name was even Wade Wilson is subject to speculation since one of his nemeses, T-Ray, claims in Deadpool #33 that he is the real Wade Wilson and that Deadpool is a vicious murderer who stole his identity.[57] There have been other dubious stories about his history—at one point the supervillain Loki claimed to be his father.[58] Frequently, revelations are later retconned or ignored altogether, and in one issue, Deadpool himself joked that whether he is actually Wade Wilson depends on which the writer or the reader prefers."
}

response.name: Response: Created Success

request.description:
This method will give a list of characters which can be filtered by specific querys:
* name: Search all the character with name like the one given
* age: Search all characters with the given age
* weight: Search all characters with the given weight
* movieId: Search for all characters that have an association with the given movie id

request.description: This method will search a character with the id given on the path variable **:/id**. If the character is found, the server will return the detailed data from the character, if not, will send an error communicating that it was not found.

item.description:
If you have an token to the Authorization, now you can use the API and do characters operation.
#### Character Model:
---
* **id**: *[Primary Key, Integer, Auto Increment, unique]*
* **name**: *[VARCHAR(255), Required, unique]*
* **image_url**: *[VARCHAR(255), Required]*
* **age**: *[Integer, unsigned]*
* **weight**: *[Integer]*
* **history**: *[Text]*

item.name: Movies

request.description:
This operation saves a movie object in the database. For this you must send an object with the correct data.
* title(string)
* image_url(url)
* releaseDate(date)
* rating(number)

response.name: Response: Image is required
Response: Image must be an URL
Response: Rating is Required
Response: ReleaseDate must be a Date
Response: Rating is Required

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

request.description:
This method returns a list of objects with some data of all movies in the database.
You can filter the the data received by specific query params:
* order: sorts the data received by the release date. The only options available are **ASC** and **DESC**(DESC by default).
* title: Search all the movies with the title like the one given
* releaseDate: Filter the data by the date given
* genre: Filter the data by the associate genres with the same id as given

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

item.description:
If you have an token to the Authorization, now you can do movie operations.
#### Movie Model
---
* **id**: *[Primary Key, Integer, Auto Increment, unique]*
* **title**: *[VARCHAR(255), Required, unique]*
* **image_url**: *[VARCHAR(255), Required]*
* **releaseDate**: *[DATE, Required]*
* **rating**: *[Integer(min: 1,max:5), Required]*

item.name: Genres

request.description:
This operation saves a genre object in the database. For this you must send an object with the correct data.
* name (string)
* image_url (URL)

response.name: Response: Image is required

request.description: This method returns an array of objects with the genres in the database. You can filter the data received by the name of the genre with the query **name**.

item.description:
If you're authenticated, you can do operations to create, read, update and delete genres from the database.
#### Genre Schema
---
* **id**: [Primary Key, Integer, Auto Increment, unique]
* **name**: [VARCHAR(255), Required, unique]
* **image_url**: [VARCHAR(255), Required]

item.description:
#### ATTENTION
For  users operations you must have an **ADMIN** role, only the user with the admin role can do the CRUD operations with users.

#### User model
* id: **[ Integer, Auto Increment, PrimaryKey ]** 
* role: **[ enum('USER_ROLE','ADMIN_ROLE') default:'USER_ROLE' ]** 
* firstname: **[ String(max:50) ]**  
* lastname: **[ String(max:50) ]**  
* username: **[ String(max:16), required ]**  
* email: **[ String(80), required ]** 
* password: **[ String(255) encrypted, required ]**
* enabled: **[ tinyint(1), default:1 ]**

item.name: Associations

variable.value: The id of the movie you want to associate
The id of the character you want to associate

request.description: This method creates an association between the movie table and the characters table, for this you need to give the id of the movie in movieId path variable and give the id of the character in the charId path variable, this will create the association automatically.

variable.value: The id of the movie you want to associate
The id of the genre you want to associate

request.description: This method creates an association between the movie table and the genres table, for this you need to give the id of the movie in movieId path variable and give the id of the genre in the charId path variable, this will create the association automatically.

item.description: This operations will create Many to Many relationship between tables, all registered users can execute this operation.

variable.value: You need to get this token by authentication
